job_title: Medical Lab Technologist in Winnipeg, MB
pros: I really enjoyed the people I worked with and helping out patient with their treatment
cons: Management was unsupportive in my department, other departments were better

review_title: Retirement looks so very far away
job_title: Health Care Aide in Winnipeg, MB
pros: I work with some of the kindest, hardest working, most decent people as co-workers.
cons: No matter how hard I work or try to be brave and decent or thoughtful for my patients or be a good health care team member, my life doesn't matter so much if I earn below a certain income.

pros:
Amazing environment. Positive and supportive colleagues. 
Lots of opportunities to team bond. Overall positive workplace.
cons: Workload can be heavy at times.

review_title: wise if you have a back up plan
pros: Decent salary depending on the sector you are from Benefits ok but have been cut repeatedly over past 15 years Defined benefit pension
cons: Pension not indexed if hired now Penalty if early retirement, unless you top up yourself Not a meritocracy, sycophants at every level HR is very powerful

cons: A very hierarchical and old school organization

pros: Work from home right now

pros: Work life balance. Flexible work arrangements.
cons: There are no cons at this time.

pros: Employees are knowledgeable, kind and ready to collaborate.
cons: Worked as a contractor. No opportunity for permanent full-time role in a small Finance department.

pros: Nice building to work at
cons: Pay their employees horribly. poor management

pros:
- Approachable senior investment professionals sharing their expertise.
- Broad investment strategies bringing good learning opportunities.
- Small team with a collaborative culture surpassing silos when making investment decisions.
- Great organizational support, both in terms of infrastructure and flexible working hours during the COVID19.
- Caring team leaders bringing out the best in every member of the team.
cons:
- Smaller network of industry professionals in Ottawa.
- Security software controls slowing computer systems when working remotely and occasionally at office.

pros: CMPA is an organization who is committed to supporting their employees
cons: Previously known as slow to implement change but this is improving under new leadership

pros: Great work life balance and employee benefits
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: Wellness focused and a professional work environment
pros:
- The work we do is meaningful
- Great benefits and pension
- Gym and group fitness studio on-site
- On-site cafeteria with daily specials and a really nice salad bar
- Mid-size company (about 370 employees) so there is a nice community feel
- The executive team is extremely approachable (most days they’re eating in the cafeteria with employees)
- Great focus on work/life balance with flexible start and end times
cons:
- Change can be slow / not welcomed depending on the leader
- Needs to implement a more open and accepted approach to work from home

pros: Medium company of 300-400 people. People there are very nice and professional. The environment there (inside and outside) is excellent. There are company wide activities during Christmas and department wide activities every month which are very good. They provide excellent benefit. And the cafe there is very nice. It's a good company to work for.
cons: It's a government like company. People enter the company and most of them stay there for ever. The average employee age is 45+. The work efficiency there needs to be improved.

pros: The CMPA is a rock-solid organization, offering stability and a mostly friendly atmosphere. Many employees have been with the organization for years, even decades. There are good reasons for that, and that is few other employers can match (let alone beat) CMPA.
cons: Perhaps because of its relatively small size (350 employees) and hierarchical culture (there's a clique of staff doctors who aren't always easy to work with), it's not the most exciting or dynamic place for millennials and younger people looking for new challenges.  It really depends on your current life situation and expectations.

job_title: Instructional Designer/Graphic Designer in Ottawa, ON
pros: Positive, professional environment; lots of perks (free heated underground parking, two gyms, exercise classes, cafeteria), good benefits package. Active staff association and involved management. Directors and managers (in my department anyway) are accessible and responsive.
cons:
Not a lot of upward career movement - it's improved in the last 5 years, but still not brilliant. 
Change is slow. Again, it's improvement, but there's a way to go.

review_title: Great solid employer with good work and good benefits
pros:
Competitive wages and benefits
Productive and hardworking people
Great location (Dow's lake and Little Italy)
Great perks like a gym, yoga, cafeteria, massage, parking, compressed work days
cons:
Growing very fast
Lots of change
Lots of work
Not very technologically advanced, although it's a priority

pros:
Excellent physical work environment
Defined benefit Pension tho not indexed
cons:
Bilingualism supposed to be an asset but not financially recognized 
Too much middle management 
Can’t work from home 
Pay scale progress based on performance not seniority 
Performance indicators vague
Favoritism 
No women in senior management tho woman president now

review_title: Stable job and nice work environment
pros: There are nice people and good work environment. The benefit is pretty good and you can call it a secure job.
cons: The work efficiency is a problem. The company lacks of vitality. Changes are slow. Not good for career development.
